alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 8:26PM CDT until May 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma...Arkansas... Lee Creek near Van Buren affecting Crawford and Sequoyah Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lee Creek near Van Buren. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 402.0 feet, the access road into Tailwater Park may be impassable due to high water. The recreational vehicle campground near Rena Road is affected by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 393.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday afternoon to a crest of 402.0 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 401.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
